text: The air freezes in place. The chanting stops. Several pairs of eyes shift toward us from the shadows—cold, silent, yet burning with a twisted fervor.
I don’t hesitate. Snow and grit scatter beneath my boots as I launch forward, firelight flashing along my short blade. The robed figures clearly didn’t expect me to charge straight in.
The ritual circle still pulses. The nearest caster raises a hand, murmuring a spell. The air tightens like warped threads winding around me.
I twist to dodge—but my foot catches on loose stone. My blade slices through half an arc and misses. Blue light erupts in front of me.
A searing pain rips through my arm, like being branded with heated iron. I stagger back, blood dripping from my sleeve onto the ground.
“Hey! You’re bleeding!”
Lucia cries out and swings her staff. A wall of light surges up in front of me.
Blue force slams into the barrier, sparks flying. Lucia’s face glows red in the reflection as she grits her teeth, bracing against the impact.
“Forget me—free her first!”
“The blood of mortals… is enough to awaken the core.”
A chill runs through me. I realize the sigils are lighting up along the trail of my blood. Blue lines slither back toward the stone pillar, feeding on it.
“No—I’ll disrupt it!”
Her voice nearly drowns in the roaring energy. She forms a seal, her staff blazing brighter.
She rushes forward, a sphere of light bursting from her hand and blasting the nearest robed figure off his feet.
I force myself upright and lunge, hacking through the last restraint binding Alicia. In that instant, the ritual’s light recoils violently.
A violent backlash of energy slams into me. I’m thrown against the wall, breath crushed from my lungs, ears ringing until everything fades into a dull hum.
Through blurred vision, I see Lucia kneeling, gasping. Alicia falls from midair, caught just in time by Lucia’s arms.
The light dims. The air fills with the smell of ash and blood.
“Interlopers… you invite your own doom.”
The leader’s voice cuts like frost. Then he turns and vanishes into warped light.
The remaining robed figures scatter as the ritual circle collapses.
“Are you alright?!”
Gravely wounded, Alicia can only lean against Lucia’s shoulder as they move toward me step by step.
“Don’t move.”
Her voice is weak but firm. Leaning on Lucia, she traces glowing sigils in the air.
A soft radiance settles over my wound. The pain eases slightly, though blood still seeps. She exhales sharply. “Temporary clotting spell. You need rest.”
I manage a faint smile. “Looks like you and Lucia saved me again.”
“Your blood… the ritual absorbed part of it. You may have been drawn into its residual circuit.”
“Meaning?”
“For now, nothing. But… if you approach similar spellwork again, it might respond.”
Her hand rests over mine, her palm cold. “Promise me you won’t rush in like that again.”
I hesitate. Her fingers tighten just slightly—barely any pressure, yet impossible to ignore.
We make our way out of the tunnel. The night wind outside cuts like a blade. In the distance, the inn’s lantern flickers.
“Will they come back?”
“They will.”
Alicia’s voice is low and strained. “But we’ll be faster.”
Snow crunches underfoot. The wind tangles her hair and scatters the last traces of the ritual’s energy.
I glance down at my bandaged arm, unease stirring within me. The afterimage of that blue glow still seems to flicker deep beneath my skin.
